analyzed: bstod pa dang grags pa dang bde ba dang rnyed pa dag gis yid dga' bar mi bya ste /

analyzed: gal te gdung ba byung na yang nan tan gyis gzhom par bya'o //
translated: If torment arises, one should conquer it with practice.

analyzed: gang zhig de ltar spyod pa de ni bla ma sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de dag 'dren pa mthong ba yin //

original: dge slong dag 'jig tshogs la skur ma 'dzin par dge slong dag nga ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par ltos shig ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig tshogs la skur ma 'dzin par dge slong dag nga ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par ltos shig ces gsungs pas /
translated: Monks, do not hold the Tathāgata to be a perishable collection! Monks, you should see me as the perfect fulfillment of the body of truth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni yang dag pa'i mtha' rtag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni yang dag pa'i mtha' rtag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is the eternal limit of reality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par blta'o zhes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par blta'o zhes so //
translated: It should be seen as the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: And the same text says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi skur mi blta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi skur mi blta ste /
translated: The Tathāgata should not be seen as a body of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is the body of truth.

original: rigs kyi bu chos nyid ni 'ong ba'am 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos nyid ni 'ong ba'am 'gro ba med de /
translated: Son of noble family, the nature of reality does not come or go.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byon pa'am bzhud pa med do zhes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byon pa'am bzhud pa med do zhes so //
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, the Tathāgatas do not come or go.

original: gang yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa @79b las kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa @79b las kyang gsungs pa /
translated: And the noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka also says,

original: gang zag med cing phung po med //
analyzed: gang zag med cing phung po med //
translated: There are no persons and there are no aggregates.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes zag med pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes zag med pa //
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha is uncontaminated.

original: rtag tu zhi ba rnam bsgom ste //
analyzed: rtag tu zhi ba rnam bsgom ste //
translated: Always meditate on peace.

original: de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to that.

original: zhes so // de ltar lus rang bzhin med pa dang / ngag rang bzhin med pa dang / yid rang bzhin med par bsgom pa ni chos kyi sku rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar lus rang bzhin med pa dang / ngag rang bzhin med pa dang / yid rang bzhin med par bsgom pa ni chos kyi sku rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meditation on the body as essenceless, the meditation on speech as essenceless, and the meditation on mind as essenceless is the recollection of the Dharma Body.

original: gzhan yang phan par dga' bar 'dod pa'i lha'i sku'i nga rgyal 'chang ba ni gzugs kyi sku rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan par dga' bar 'dod pa'i lha'i sku'i nga rgyal 'chang ba ni gzugs kyi sku rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the recollection of the Form Body is the pride of being the deity who is pleased with the desire to benefit others.

original: 'di lta bu'i rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas lus kyi spyod pa ni tshul mi 'chos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas lus kyi spyod pa ni tshul mi 'chos par bya'o //
translated: By cultivating this kind of recollection, one should not be hypocritical in one's physical conduct.

original: gcig pu rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig pu rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: One should move about alone.

original: gnod pa skyob pa tsam las lus brgyan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa skyob pa tsam las lus brgyan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not adorn one's body except to protect oneself from harm.

original: slong mos 'tsho bar bya'o //
analyzed: slong mos 'tsho bar bya'o //
translated: One should live by begging.

original: mi rigs pa'i bsnyen bkur mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i bsnyen bkur mi bya'o //
translated: One should not accept improper service.

original: ngag gi spyod pa ni don med par mi smra'o //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod pa ni don med par mi smra'o //
translated: One should not speak meaninglessly.

original: 'brel pa dang bcas bzhin du yid du 'ong bar smra'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang bcas bzhin du yid du 'ong bar smra'o //
translated: One should speak pleasantly, but with a purpose.

original: gzhan la gdung bskyed pa mi smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gdung bskyed pa mi smra'o //
translated: One should not speak in a way that torments others.

original: rtog pa sngon la song bas smra'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon la song bas smra'o //
translated: One should speak with prior reflection.

original: gsal zhing dpes khrid de smra'o //
analyzed: gsal zhing dpes khrid de smra'o //
translated: One should speak clearly and with examples.

original: pha rol gyi lan thebs par smra'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi lan thebs par smra'o //
translated: I will speak to counter the opponent’s position.

original: yid kyi spyod pa ni brtan pa dang / dul ba dang / ma khengs pa dang / ma zhum par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod pa ni brtan pa dang / dul ba dang / ma khengs pa dang / ma zhum par bya'o //
translated: The conduct of the mind should be firm, disciplined, not arrogant, and not timid.

original: phyogs las rgyal ba dang / pha rol gyi ngor mi lta ba dang / ma yengs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs las rgyal ba dang / pha rol gyi ngor mi lta ba dang / ma yengs par bya'o //
translated: One should be victorious in all directions, not looking at the opponent’s face, and undistracted.

original: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang lhan cig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang lhan cig par bya'o //
translated: One should be accompanied by mindfulness and alertness.

original: mi'i mchog gang zhig 'di lta bus rjes su dran pa dang / spyod pa la gzhol ba de dag ni ring por mi thogs par 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i mchog gang zhig 'di lta bus rjes su dran pa dang / spyod pa la gzhol ba de dag ni ring por mi thogs par 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are the best among men, who are thus devoted to recollection and conduct, will before long attain the highest prosperity.

original: chu nang padma nyi ma'i zer phye rab rgyas dga' skyed ltar //🔽bla med rjes dran padma gzhung gi zer phye dga' skyed pa //
analyzed: chu nang padma nyi ma'i zer phye rab rgyas dga' skyed ltar // bla med rjes dran padma gzhung gi zer phye dga' skyed pa //
translated: Just as a lotus in the water, opened by the rays of the sun, delights,🔽so does this delight-producing lotus of the chapters, opened by the rays of the text, recollecting the unsurpassed.

original: padma'i phreng ltar legs sbyar 'dis ni skye bo ma lus pa //
analyzed: padma'i phreng ltar legs sbyar 'dis ni skye bo ma lus pa //
translated: By this well-composed garland of lotuses, all beings

original: bla med sangs rgyas rjes dran nam yang mi 'bral der 'bad shog / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bla na med pa mdo'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor chen po'i slob dpon ma h'a ma ti'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bla med sangs rgyas rjes dran nam yang mi 'bral der 'bad shog / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bla na med pa mdo'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor chen po'i slob dpon ma h'a ma ti'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The unsurpassed recollection of the Buddha called Following the Sutra was composed by the great mandala master Mahamati. It is complete.

original: // / a'a ts'ar+ya bi na ya tsandra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: // / a'a ts'ar+ya bi na ya tsandra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian abbot Vinayacandra and the Tibetan translator-monk, the learned one, Chökyi Sherab.
